item.description:

The links I am putting here are for that purpose, not in-depth studies. I have tried to put together a good collection, but of course I am not an expert in this field and would really appreciate thoughtful input.

item.title: World War II
item.description:
World War II is the dividing event of the twentieth century. There was the before: hyper-nationalism, depression, dictators, and multiple crises. There was the after: a world divided between the camps of two superpowers with competing economic and political ideologies. The war itself was epic. Enormous casualties, harrowing testimony, victimization and murder of civilians on a scale hitherto inconceivable. It has been romanticized in the years following, as the “Good War”, the struggle against Nazism and Fascism, fought by the “Greatest Generation”.

With so much attention on its study, it is difficult to find which resources are best. I have striven to collect the best sources for overviews and collections of information. Those links can then lead you to more specific topics. I am about half-way through posting links to this page, so more will be up in the next few weeks.

If you have suggestions, let me know so that I can add them in or make appropriate changes. Also, if you know of others who might find my site useful, please pass it along!

Links Regarding World War II

Additional Notes: I have left out most sites dedicated specifically to the Holocaust, as they can be found on my Links Regarding the Holocaust page. Sites focused only on specific battles, military equipment or groups are generally left out, except when notoriety insists upon their inclusion. Finally, sites centered on uniquely American experiences are generally not included as bylochacon.com is focused on world history and there is such a flood of information out there I had to limit it somehow.

**I added the rest of the links, but not the corresponding images or descriptions - that will have to come at some future date.

item.title: Between World Wars
item.description:
The period the first and second world war witnessed a staggering number of enormous changes in politics, art, technology and popular culture. Here are some links I’ve put together to begin examining the history more closely: Links Regarding the Interwar Period. I have left out links specifically focused on American history for the time being, in the interest of getting this page up and sticking to the world history focus of this site. About half the links are up today, and the rest should be up in the next week or so (I hope!). We are in the process of moving to San Francisco, and it has been time-consuming.

*I put the rest of the links (sans U.S. specific ones) up Thursday, Jan. 26th. We are moving this weekend, and it will be over soon!
